arabicText: ۞ قَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ مِن قَوْمِهِۦ لَنُخْرِجَنَّكَ يَـٰشُعَيْبُ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مَعَكَ مِن قَرْيَتِنَآ أَوْ لَتَعُودُنَّ فِى مِلَّتِنَا ۚ قَالَ أَوَلَوْ كُنَّا كَـٰرِهِينَ
englishTranslationText:
The	 proud	 leaders	 of	 his	 people	 said,	 “O	
Shuaib,	we	swear	we	will	banish	you	and	
the	 Muslims	 who	 are	 with	 you,	 from	 our	
town	or	you	must	return	to	our	religion”;	
he	said,	“Even	though	we	detest	it?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	ki	qaum	ke	mutakabbir	sardār	bole	aey	
Sho'aib!	 Qasam	 hai	 ke	 ham	 tumheiñ	 aur	
tumhāre	 sāth	 wāle	 Musalmanoñ	 ko	 apni	
basti	se	nikāl	deñge	ya	 tum	hamāre	deen	
meiñ	āa	jāo	 kahā	 kya	agarche	 hum	 bezār	
hoñ?

arabicText: قَدِ ٱفْتَرَيْنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا إِنْ عُدْنَا فِى مِلَّتِكُم بَعْدَ إِذْ نَجَّىٰنَا ٱللَّهُ مِنْهَا ۚ وَمَا يَكُونُ لَنَآ أَن نَّعُودَ فِيهَآ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّنَا ۚ وَسِعَ رَبُّنَا كُلَّ شَىْءٍ عِلْمًا ۚ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا ٱفْتَحْ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَ قَوْمِنَا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلْفَـٰتِحِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“We	shall	then	have	fabricated	a	lie	against	
Allah if	 we return	 to	 your	 religion	 after	
Allah has	rescued	us	 from	it;	and	it	is	not	
for	 any	 of	 us	 Muslims	 to	 return	 to	 your	
religion	 except	if	Allah,	Who	is	 our	 Lord,	
wills;	 the	 knowledge	 of	 our	 Lord	
encompasses	 all	 things;	 in	 Allah only	 we	
have	trusted;	our	Lord!	Decide	with	justice	
between	us	and	our	people	- and	Yours	is	
the	best	decision.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Zaroor	 hum	 Allah	 par	 jhoot	 bāñdheñ	 ge	
agar	tumhāre	deen	meiñ	āa	jāyeñ	b’ad	iske	
ke	Allah	ne	hameiñ	is	 se	bachāya	hai	aur	
ham	Musalmanoñ	meiñ	kisi	ka	kām	nahi	ke	
tumhāre	 deen	 meiñ	 āaye	 magar	 yeh	 ke	
Allah	chāhe	jo	hamāra	Rab	hai	hamāre	Rab	
ka	ilm	har	cheez	ko	muheet	(Ghere	huwe)	
hai	ham	ne	Allah	hi	par	bharosa	kiya	aey
hamāre	Rab!	hum	meiñ	aur	hamāri	qaum	
meiñ	 haq	 faisla	 kar	 aur	 tera	 faisla	 sab	 se	
behtar.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن قَوْمِهِۦ لَئِنِ ٱتَّبَعْتُمْ شُعَيْبًا إِنَّكُمْ إِذًۭا لَّخَـٰسِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	disbelieving	leaders	of	his	people	
said,	 “If	you	obey	Shuaib,	you	will	indeed	
be	in	a	loss.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	uski	qaum	ke	kāfir	sardār	bole	ke	agar	
tum	Sho'aib ke	 tābe'	huwe	 to	zaroor	 tum	
nuqsān	meiñ	rahoge.

arabicText: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلرَّجْفَةُ فَأَصْبَحُوا۟ فِى دَارِهِمْ جَـٰثِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	the	earthquake	seized	them	- so	
at	morning	 they	 remained	lying flattened	
in	their	homes.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unheiñ		zalzale	ne	āa	liya	to	subah	apne	
gharoñ		meiñ	auñdhe	pade	reh	gaye

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ شُعَيْبًۭا كَأَن لَّمْ يَغْنَوْا۟ فِيهَا ۚ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ شُعَيْبًۭا كَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْخَـٰسِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
As	if	 those	who	 denied	Shoaib	 had	 never	
lived	 in	 those	 homes;	 those	 who	 denied	
Shoaib,	were	themselves	ruined.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Sho'aib ko	 jhutlāne	 wāle	 goya	 un	 gharoñ		
meiñ	 kabhi	 rahe	 hi	 na	 they	 Sho'aib	 ko	
jhutlāne	wāle	wohi	tabāhi	meiñ	pade.

arabicText: فَتَوَلَّىٰ عَنْهُمْ وَقَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ لَقَدْ أَبْلَغْتُكُمْ رِسَـٰلَـٰتِ رَبِّى وَنَصَحْتُ لَكُمْ ۖ فَكَيْفَ ءَاسَىٰ عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍۢ كَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	Shoaib	turned	away	from	them	saying,	
“O	 my	 people!	 Indeed	 I	 did	 deliver	 my	
Lord’s	message	to	you	and	gave	you	sound	advice;	so	why	should	I	grieve	for	the	disbelievers?”	
(The	people	in	the	graves	can	hear	the	speech	of	those	who	are	on	earth.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 Sho'aib ne	 un	 se	moñh	 phera	 aur	 kahā	 aey	meri	 qaum!	Maiñ	 tumheiñ	 apne	Rab	 ki	 risalat	
pahuñcha	chuka	aur	tumhāre	bhale	ko	nasihat	ki	to	kyuñ		kar	gham	karuñ	kāfiroñ		ka.

arabicText: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا فِى قَرْيَةٍۢ مِّن نَّبِىٍّ إِلَّآ أَخَذْنَآ أَهْلَهَا بِٱلْبَأْسَآءِ وَٱلضَّرَّآءِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَضَّرَّعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	never	did	We	send	any	Prophet	to	a	dwelling	but	We	seized	its	people	with	hardship	and	
adversity	so	that	they	may	become humble.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	na	bheja	hum	ne	kisi	basti	meiñ	koi	Nabi	magar	yeh	ke	uske	logoñ	ko	sakhti	aur	takleef	meiñ	
pakda	ke	woh	kisi	tarah	zāri	(‘Ājizī)	kareñ

arabicText: ثُمَّ بَدَّلْنَا مَكَانَ ٱلسَّيِّئَةِ ٱلْحَسَنَةَ حَتَّىٰ عَفَوا۟ وَّقَالُوا۟ قَدْ مَسَّ ءَابَآءَنَا ٱلضَّرَّآءُ وَٱلسَّرَّآءُ فَأَخَذْنَـٰهُم بَغْتَةًۭ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	We	changed	the	misfortune	into	prosperity	to	the	extent	that	they	became	numerous	and	
said,	“Indeed	grief	and	comfort	did	reach	our	ancestors”	- so	We	seized	them	suddenly	in	their	
neglect.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	hum	ne	burāyi	ki	jagah	bhalāi	badal	di	yahāñ		tak	ke	woh	bahut	ho gaye	aur	bole	be-shak	
hamāre	bāp	dāda	ko	ranj	o	rāhat	pahuñche	they	to	hum	ne	unheñ		achanak	unki	ghaflat	meiñ	
pakad	liya

arabicText: وَلَوْ أَنَّ أَهْلَ ٱلْقُرَىٰٓ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَٱتَّقَوْا۟ لَفَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَرَكَـٰتٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَـٰكِن كَذَّبُوا۟ فَأَخَذْنَـٰهُم بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	had	the	people	of	the	dwellings	believed	and	been	pious,	We	would	have	surely	opened	for	
them	the	blessings	from	the	sky	and	from	the	earth,	but	in	fact	they	denied,	and	We	therefore	
seized	them	on	account	of	their	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	bastiyoñ	wāle	Imān	lāte	aur	darte	
to	zaroor	hum	un	par	āasmān	aur	zameen	
se	barkateiñ	khol	dete	magar	unhoñ	ne	to	
jhutlāya	to	Hum	ne	unheiñ		unke	kiye	par	
giriftār	kiya

arabicText: أَفَأَمِنَ أَهْلُ ٱلْقُرَىٰٓ أَن يَأْتِيَهُم بَأْسُنَا بَيَـٰتًۭا وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Do	the	people	of	the	dwellings	not	fear	that	Our	wrath	may	come	upon	them	at	night	while	they	
are	asleep?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	 bastiyoñ	 wāle	 nahi	 darte	 ke	 un	 par	
Hamāra	 ‘aƶāb	 	 rāt	 ko	 āaye	 jab	 woh	 sote	
hoñ.

arabicText: أَوَأَمِنَ أَهْلُ ٱلْقُرَىٰٓ أَن يَأْتِيَهُم بَأْسُنَا ضُحًۭى وَهُمْ يَلْعَبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Or	do	the	people	of	the	dwellings	not	fear	that	Our	wrath	may	come	upon	them	during	the	day,	
while	they	are	playing?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ya	 bastiyoñ wāle	 nahi	 darte	 ke un	 par	
hamāra	 ‘aƶāb	 din	 chadhe	 āaye	 jab	 woh	
khel	rahe	hoñ

arabicText: أَفَأَمِنُوا۟ مَكْرَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ فَلَا يَأْمَنُ مَكْرَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَّا ٱلْقَوْمُ ٱلْخَـٰسِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Are	 they	oblivious	 to	Allah’s	secret	plan?	So	none	is	unafraid	of	Allah’s	secret	plan	except	 the	
people	of	ruin!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	Allah	ki	khafi	tadbeer	se	nidar	haiñ	to	
Allah	 ki	 khafi	 tadbeer	 se	 nidar	 nahi	 hote	
magar	tabāhi	wāle

arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَهْدِ لِلَّذِينَ يَرِثُونَ ٱلْأَرْضَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ أَهْلِهَآ أَن لَّوْ نَشَآءُ أَصَبْنَـٰهُم بِذُنُوبِهِمْ ۚ وَنَطْبَعُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ فَهُمْ لَا يَسْمَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Or	did	not	those	who	inherited	the	land	after	its	owners,	get	enough	guidance	that	if	We	will,	We	
can	afflict	them	with	calamity	for	their	sins?	And	We	set	seals	upon	their	hearts	so	they	do	not	
hear
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kya	woh	jo	zameen	ke	mālikon	ke	b’ad	
uske	 wāris	 huwe	 unheiñ	 	 itni	 hidāyat	 na	
mili	 ke	 ham	 chāheiñ	 to	 unheiñ	 	 unke	
gunahoñ		par	āafat	pahuñchayeñ	aur	hum	
unke	diloñ		par	mohar	karte	haiñ	ke	woh	
kuchh	nahi	sunte

arabicText: تِلْكَ ٱلْقُرَىٰ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ أَنۢبَآئِهَا ۚ وَلَقَدْ جَآءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ فَمَا كَانُوا۟ لِيُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِمَا كَذَّبُوا۟ مِن قَبْلُ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَطْبَعُ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
These	are	the	dwellings	- the	affairs	of	which	We	relate	to	you	(Prophet	Muhammad - peace	and	
blessings	be	upon	him);	and	indeed	their	(respective)	Noble	Messengers	came	to	them	with	clear	
proofs;	so	they	were	not	able	to	believe	in	what	they	had	denied	before;	this	is	how	Allah sets	
seals	upon	the	hearts	of	disbelievers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	 bastiyāñ	 haiñ	 jin	 ke	 ahwāl	 hum	
tumheiñ	sunāte	haiñ	aur	be-shak	unke	pās	
unke	Rasool	raushan	daleeleiñ	lekar	āaye	
to	woh	is	qābil	na	huwe	ke	woh	us	par	Imān	lāte	jise	pehle	jhutla	chuke	they	Allah	yooñ	hi	chhāp	
(Mohar)	laga	deta	hai	kāfiroñ		ke	diloñ		par

arabicText: وَمَا وَجَدْنَا لِأَكْثَرِهِم مِّنْ عَهْدٍۢ ۖ وَإِن وَجَدْنَآ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَفَـٰسِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 We	 found	 most	 of	 them	 not	 true	 to	 their	 words;	 and	 indeed	 We	 found	 most	 of	 them	
disobedient.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	meiñ	aksar	ko	hum	ne	qaul	(W’āde)	ka	sachcha	na	pāya	aur	zaroor	un	meiñ	aksar	ko	be	
ḥukm		hi	pāya
